intro: Jacea degeniana, commonly known as the Degen's jacea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat head, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Jacea degeniana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and coastal winds.
